articles.content: Talking about him coming to bat when DC were 62/5 after losing three wickets in eighth over against SRH, Axar Patel said, "I couldn't figure out what was happening." He added, "I had ordered coffee. I had to leave the glass as it is and come out to bat." Axar scored 34(34), helping DC put up a total of 144/9.
articles.title: I had ordered coffee, had to leave glass as it is: Axar on DC losing 3 wickets in 1 over
articles.subtitle: DC defeated SRH by seven runs

articles.content: DC captain David Warner's reaction after his team defeated SRH in last over in their IPL 2023 match on Monday went viral. Warner was seen jumping in joy after Mukesh Kumar defended 13 runs in the last over. Notably, Warner represented SRH from 2014 to 2021. DC defended a total of less than 150 for the first time in IPL.
articles.title: David Warner's reaction after DC defeat SRH in last over goes viral
articles.subtitle: 'If Warner's reaction can sum it up'

articles.content: New Zealand broke the world record for the highest fifth-wicket partnership in T20I cricket history during the fifth T20I against Pakistan. Mark Chapman and Jimmy Neesham shared an unbeaten stand of 121 runs to set the record. The previous record (119 runs) was jointly held by Pakistan's Misbah-ul-Haq and Shoaib Malik, and Ireland's George Dockrell and Curtis Campher.
articles.title: New Zealand break world record for highest 5th wicket partnership in T20I cricket
articles.subtitle: NZ chased down 194-run target to win 5th T20I

articles.content: Delhi Capitals (DC) on Monday successfully defended their lowest total in IPL history, defeating SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) by seven runs. DC put up a total of 144/9 and managed to restrict SRH to 137/6 in their 20 overs. DC have now won two matches in a row, while SRH have suffered three straight defeats.
articles.title: DC defend their lowest total in IPL history, beat SRH to record their 2nd straight win
articles.subtitle: Previous lowest total defended by DC was 150/3

articles.content: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said CSK captain MS Dhoni might play for one or two years more because of the Impact Player rule. "It's great for the game...You never want these heroes...of the game to get retired whether it's his last year or not," added Lee. Dhoni recently stated that he's currently in the last phase of his career.
articles.title: Dhoni might play for a yr or 2 more due to Impact Player rule: Lee
articles.subtitle: 'Super impressed by the way Dhoni is playing'

articles.content: RCB's Virat Kohli has become the first captain to be fined ₹24 lakh for slow over-rate in IPL 2023. Kohli was fined ₹24 lakh as RCB committed their second over-rate offence of the season (against RR). Other members of RCB's playing XI and Impact Substitute have been fined ₹6 lakh or 25% of the match fee, whichever is lesser.
articles.title: Virat Kohli becomes 1st captain to be fined ₹24 lakh for slow over-rate in IPL 2023
articles.subtitle: Kohli captained RCB vs RR due to injury to Faf

articles.content: McLaren F1 CEO Zak Brown said rookie Oscar Piastri will soon be on a "similar pace" to experienced driver Lando Norris. "We want...two drivers [who] are pushing each other...having two Grand Prix drivers is critically important," said Brown. He added that the onus was on the team to give the drivers a "car to get to the front".
articles.title: Oscar Piastri will soon be on same pace as Norris: McLaren F1 CEO
articles.subtitle: 'Lando's contract has zero exit clauses'

articles.content: Commentator Harsha Bhogle took to Twitter to state that Sachin Tendulkar's 50th birthday should be celebrated as much as his 100 tons in international cricket. "Knowing you as a person has been heartwarming because you didn't let fame...affect you," added Harsha. "May your work ethic, your attitude and your humility rub off on every generation of Indian cricketers," he stated.
articles.title: Sachin turning 50 should be celebrated as much as 100 tons: Harsha
articles.subtitle: 'Seeing you as a cricketer was joy to behold'

articles.content: Red Bull F1 reserve driver Daniel Ricciardo said he will only want to race with a top team in 2024 instead of "starting from scratch". "I don't want [just] any seat next year...I don't want to just start from zero, and...build my career," he said. Ricciardo added that he's "not scared" of the lack of seats next season.
articles.title: Don't want just any F1 seat, looking only at top teams: Ricciardo
articles.subtitle: 'It's not coming from an arrogant place'

articles.content: Talking about Prithvi Shaw who was dropped for DC's IPL 2023 match against SRH, having scored 47 runs in six matches, ex-New Zealand cricketer Simon Doull said, "I don't think Shaw's fit at all." "He sat on the backside of the bench...when DC were fielding against RCB...When he came out [to bat] he was lazy with the running," added Doull.
articles.title: Shaw isn't fit at all, he sat on backside vs RCB: Simon Doull
articles.subtitle: 'Prithvi Shaw has to understand where he is'
